intro: Brunellia amayensis, commonly known as the Mexican wax tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to Central America and northern South America, where it typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant is characterized by its woody structure, broad leaves, and showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It produces capsule fruits containing small, smooth seeds. Brunellia amayensis is often found in humid, lowland areas and can thrive in a variety of soil types.
